LocalSoftware.Name: blast-legacy
LocalSoftware.Description: NCBI BLAST sequence alignment package. The program compares nucleotide or protein sequences to sequence databases and calculates the statistical significance of matches.

LocalSoftware.Name: qiime
LocalSoftware.Description: QIIME is an open source software package for comparison and analysis of microbial communities, primarily based on high-throughput amplicon sequencing data (such as SSU rRNA) generated on a variety of platforms, but also supporting analysis of other types of data (such as shotgun metagenomic data).

LocalSoftware.Name: tophat
LocalSoftware.Description: TopHat2 is a fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons.

LocalSoftware.Name: tophat
LocalSoftware.Description: TopHat2 is a fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons.

LocalSoftware.Description: TopHat2 is a fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons.

LocalSoftware.Name: kracken
LocalSoftware.Description: Kraken is a system for assigning taxonomic labels to short DNA sequences, usually obtained through metagenomic studies.

LocalSoftware.Name: varscan
LocalSoftware.Description: VarScan is a platform-independent mutation caller for targeted, exome, and whole-genome resequencing data generated on Illumina, SOLiD, Life/PGM, Roche/454, and similar instruments.

LocalSoftware.Name: mutect
LocalSoftware.Description: MuTect is a method developed at the Broad Institute for the reliable and accurate identification of somatic point mutations in next generation sequencing data of cancer genomes.

LocalSoftware.Name: sga
LocalSoftware.Description: SGA is a de novo assembler designed to assemble large genomes from high coverage short read data.

LocalSoftware.Name: trf
LocalSoftware.Description: Tandem Repeats Finder is a program to locate and display tandem repeats in DNA sequences.

LocalSoftware.Description: MUMmer - A modular system for the rapid whole genome alignment of finished or draft sequence

LocalSoftware.Name: mosaik
LocalSoftware.Description: MOSAIK is a reference-guided aligner for next-generation sequencing technologies.

LocalSoftware.Description: GAP is a system for computational discrete algebra, with particular emphasis on Computational Group Theory.

LocalSoftware.Description: The purpose of this program is to generate metrics at single nucleotide positions.

LocalSoftware.Description: Scans a range of protein signatures against your sequences and provides protein functional analysis.

LocalSoftware.Name: cutadapt
LocalSoftware.Description: Cutadapt removes adapter sequences from DNA high-throughput sequencing data.

LocalSoftware.Name: oases
LocalSoftware.Description: Oases - De novo transcriptome assembler for very short reads.

LocalSoftware.Name: soapdenovo2
LocalSoftware.Description: soapdenovo2 - novel short-read assembly method that can build a de novo draft assembly for the human-sized genomes

LocalSoftware.Description: MyTaxa - Assign taxonomy to metagenomic fragments.

LocalSoftware.Description: scan_for_matches is a utility written in C for locating patterns in DNA or protein FASTA files.

LocalSoftware.Name: prodigal
LocalSoftware.Description: Prodigal (Prokaryotic Dynamic Programming Genefinding Algorithm) is a microbial (bacterial and archaeal) gene finding program developed at Oak Ridge National Laboratory and the University of Tennessee.

LocalSoftware.Name: tassel
LocalSoftware.Description: While TASSEL has changed considerably since its initial public release in 2001, its primary function continues to be providing tools to investigate the relationship between phenotypes and genotypes1. As indicated by its title â€“ Trait Analysis by aSSociation, Evolution and Linkage â€“ TASSEL has multiple functions, including association study, evaluating evolutionary relationships, analysis of linkage disequilibrium, principal component analysis, cluster analysis, missing data imputation and data visualization.

LocalSoftware.Name: signalp
LocalSoftware.Description: signalp predicts the presence and location of signal peptide cleavage sites in amino acid sequences from different organisms: Gram-positive bacteria, Gram-negative bacteria, and eukaryotes.

LocalSoftware.Name: blat
LocalSoftware.Description: Blat is an alignment tool like BLAST, but it is structured differently. On DNA, Blat works by keeping an index of an entire genome in memory. Thus, the target database of BLAT is not a set of GenBank sequences, but instead an index derived from the assembly of the entire genome.

LocalSoftware.Description: 'Sage is a free open-source mathematics software system licensed under the GPL. It builds on top of many existing open-source packages: NumPy, SciPy, matplotlib, Sympy, Maxima, GAP, FLINT, R and many more.' Mission: 'Creating a viable free open source alternative to Magma, Maple, Mathematica and Matlab.'

LocalSoftware.Name: blast
LocalSoftware.Description: NCBI BLAST+ sequence alignment package. The program compares nucleotide or protein sequences to sequence databases and calculates the statistical significance of matches.

LocalSoftware.Name: phrap
LocalSoftware.Description: Phrap is a program for assembling shotgun DNA sequence data. Cross_match is a general purpose utility for comparing any two DNA sequence sets using a 'banded' version of swat. Swat is a program for searching one or more DNA or protein query sequences, or a query profile, against a sequence database, using an efficient implementation of the Smith-Waterman or Needleman-Wunsch algorithms with linear (affine) gap penalties.
